pull_request.title: Improved signing support
pull_request.body:
Fixes #295 adding support for any digest algorithm; SHA512 remains default if nothing else is specified.
Also removes manual CI approval from upstream-initiated builds.

- [x] documentation is added or updated
- [x] tests are added or updated

repo.name: openssl
repo.description: Fork of OpenSSL that includes prototype quantum-resistant algorithms and ciphersuites based on liboqs

repo.name: openssl
repo.description: Fork of OpenSSL that includes prototype quantum-resistant algorithms and ciphersuites based on liboqs

pull_request.title: Enable liboqs build in UEFI/EDKII.
pull_request.body:
UEFI/EDKII used openssl as crypto lib with OPENSSL_SYS_UEFI.

This patch adds __UEFI__ macro in liboqs to indicate special build in UEFI/EDKII.
With this patch, we can start building liboqs in UEFI/EDKII.

For algorithm specific patches, we will submit one by one later.

Signed-off-by: Jiewen Yao <jiewen.yao@intel.com>

repo.name: liboqs
repo.description: C library for prototyping and experimenting with quantum-resistant cryptography

pull_request.title: Enable liboqs build in UEFI/EDKII.
pull_request.body:
UEFI/EDKII used openssl as crypto lib with OPENSSL_SYS_UEFI.

This patch adds OQS_SYS_UEFI macro in liboqs to indicate special build in UEFI/EDKII.
With this patch, we can start building liboqs in UEFI/EDKII.

For algorithm specific patches, we will submit one by one later.

Signed-off-by: Jiewen Yao <jiewen.yao@intel.com>

repo.name: liboqs
repo.description: C library for prototyping and experimenting with quantum-resistant cryptography

pull_request.title: Enable OQS OPENSSL for UEFI/EDKII.
pull_request.body:
1) Add OPENSSL_NO_CMS around CMS_SignerInfo_get0_algs().
Otherwise, it causes UEFI EDKII link failure.

2) Add #include <openssl/rsa.h> for RSA_PKCS1_PADDING.
Otherwise, it causes UEFI EDKII build failure.

Signed-off-by: Jiewen Yao <jiewen.yao@intel.com>

repo.name: liboqs
repo.description: C library for prototyping and experimenting with quantum-resistant cryptography

pull_request.title: Improve random sources when not using OpenSSL
pull_request.body:
Our `common/rand/rand.c` has two Linux/macOS implementations of OQS_randombytes_system. One uses the getrandom syscall through the getentropy interface. The other reads from /dev/urandom.

The getentropy-based implementation fails to respect the 256 byte length limit on getentropy calls and hangs in an infinite loop when longer requests are made. It is also guarded by `#if defined(HAVE_GETENTROPY)`, and we aren't setting HAVE_GETENTROPY anywhere.

The other implementation uses C standard buffered I/O (fopen, fread) to /dev/urandom. There are problems with how it handles fopen and fread errors.
 * On fopen failure it calls "delay" and then attempts to open the file again. The "delay" function is optimized out at -O2, and in general `fopen` errors are not recoverable.
 * On fread failure (specifically a short return) it would call delay and then attempt to read again. A short return from fread is an unrecoverable error and not a signal to try again.

The first commit in this PR fixes the getentropy-based implementation.

The second commit adds CMake logic to set an `OQS_HAVE_GETENTROPY` define. This makes getentropy the default on recent systems when we are not using OpenSSL.

The third commit improves the use of fopen/fread. There probably are recoverable errors for fopen (maybe EINTR?), so I'm open to suggestions there.

Our `common/rand/rand.c` has two Linux/macOS implementations of OQS_randombytes_system. One uses the getrandom syscall through the getentropy interface. The other reads from /dev/urandom.
